verbose_text: Increased ceramide concentrations in bronchial epithelial cells and lung macrophages of Cftr deficient mice trigger several hallmarks of cystic fibrosis, i.e. death of respiratory epithelial cells and deposition of DNA in bronchi, chronic pulmonary inflammation and high susceptibility of Cftr deficient mice to develop pulmonary P. aeruginosa infections.
evidence: Cftr-deficient mice trigger several hallmarks of cystic fibrosis, i.e. death of respiratory epithelial cells and deposition of DNA in bronchi, chronic pulmonary inflammation
